question: Facts about isaac please?
answer:
‪What facts about him do you want? There are like a lot of facts but if you want some facts in particular just tell me. I’m going to start with the basic facts.‬

  • ‪He had no interest in acting until he joined a drama club to avoid playing football on Saturday mornings during the cold months of the year and he began acting in commercials. He studied acting at the Kent Youth Theatre in Canterbury, England.‬
  • ‪His screen debut was in the horror movie The Awakening in 2011. (You should see this movie. His acting skills were amazing at a young age!)‬
  • ‪He has lent voice to characters in many TV shows & Films such as- Revolting Rhymes Part Two, The Boxtrolls, Family Guy. (Here you can see Isaac with his character of Boxtrolls).
  • ‪When he was younger, he said that he would like to be in Sherlock and now he would love to work with director Yorgos Lanthimos. ‬
  • ‪He plays the piano, guitar and ukelele.‬
  • ‪He is in the music video Fire That Burns by Circa Waves playing the piano and in the Foals music video Exits.‬
  • ‪He studied maths at univertity of Birmingham but dropped out. In September he’ll go back to uni to study neuroscience. (Yep! We stan a clever boy)‬
  • ‪He has a tattoo on his arm of a circle. Here you can see it! ‬
  • ‪His new movie project is voyagers, a kind of lord of the flies in the space. (Yay! can’t wait)‬

‪These are the basic things! If you want to know something in particular let me know! ‬

summary: I feel like the a lot of the youths in asoiaf are a bit too mature and/or intelligent for their ages (regardless of life...
question: I feel like the a lot of the youths in asoiaf are a bit too mature and/or intelligent for their ages (regardless of life experiences). Could you name a few characters that you feel has an accurate depiction regarding their age and mentality + actions?
answer:
I get where you’re coming from, Anon, and I agree to some extent. However, the only POV that really feels way too old to me is Bran’s. GRRM has said that he has trouble with Bran’s POV the most because it’s hard to write from the mind of someone that young, and yeah, it shows in his writing sometimes. Even with Bran, though, there are plenty of times when Bran sounds age appropriate (Like “Why would anyone kill Jory?” or “He sent sweets to Hodor and Old Nan as well, for no reason but he loved them.”)

But, you asked for examples, so here’s my thoughts on it:

Jon’s POV is age appropriate, to an extent. At the start of his story, he’s an angsty, bratty teen with a good heart, and reads like it, for the most part.

I think Sansa and Arya start off acting their age, for sure. Sansa’s romanticism in the beginning of her arc is age appropriate, and written accordingly. I love that Arya calls everything and everyone “stupid,” and Sansa refers to her stomach as her “tummy.” Language like that definitely shows their age. Also, Sansa and Arya’s sisterly beef with each other is written perfectly, considering their ages.

However, after Sansa goes through her trauma and has grown accustomed to being a prisoner, her POV matures in a way that, while fascinating to read, still feels a bit too “old” sometimes in my opinion, if that makes sense. Like, she’s just 13, but she tends to sound like someone in their later teens, and though that doesn’t sound like a huge difference, the mind of someone who’s 17-19 is far different from someone who just turned 13. I get why GRRM would do that, because trauma can definitely age a child, and it’s beautiful writing, but I think sometimes it’s just too old in how it reads. IIRC, though (correct me if I’m wrong, I’m not a Sansa expert), she still calls her stomach her “tummy,” so there’s that. That word is associated with youth and innocence, so when Sansa starts saying “stomach” or “belly” more than “tummy” … I think it’ll be kinda sad, because it will represent more of her lost/stolen innocence, due to her trauma.

I think George does a better job with making Arya still sound childish, even after she’s traumatized. The way she thinks of her lost identity (“had she dreamed Arya Stark?”) gets the job done as far as storytelling and characterization goes, while saying it in a “childish” way.

Dany’s POV is weird. Sometimes she sounds young — maybe not as young as 13, but considering her backstory, she’s been forced to grow up long before the Stark children, so that makes sense. I think if her story started when she was 15 instead of 13, it would sound more “right,” but honestly, with the whole dramatically written crush over Daario and the mistakes she makes as a ruler, I think you can tell that she’s a teenager.

I think Theon’s POV is age appropriate. He’s college age, and acts like a particularly douchey frat boy. And when the Reek thing happens, he’s old enough that the change in prose doesn’t sound awkward. It’s all written perfectly.

Also, if non-POV characters count, Tommen and Sweetrobin act pretty age appropriate. Myrcella feels like an intelligent child. I don’t know, I think GRRM does a good job on this for the most part.

title: home
body:
pairings: Bran Stark x plus size!reader

request: Hey :) I was wondering if I could request a bran x plus size reader where they both get put in an arranged marriage because they’re both considered too “undesirable” for any “normal” person to marry but they both end up loving each other despite everything ❤️❤️❤️

word count: +1400

A/N: This is an AU where the Starks are well and alive. Also I’d like to thank to the person who requested it because I loved writing it. (Oh an yes, I’ll keep using gifs from that one Bran scene). Feel free to request.

You were nervous to say the least. And this was not helping at all. Your mother had brought you the best handmaidens out there to groom you for your first meeting to your betrothed.

You hated it. You felt a absolutely ridiculous with the gown they had chosen for you to wear today: it was a baby pink gown with very long sleeves you were afraid to step on.

“It’s useless” you thought. Your betrothed was from the noble House Stark, located in the North, you’d have to wear a furry coat on top of it so you didn’t die from the cold, no one was going to notice the dress.

That was not the worst thing. You almost begged your mother to let you wear something black.

“That’s ridiculous, we’re not attending a funeral Y/N” she said.

You wanted wear black because it’s the color you felt comfortable with, now they were dressing you up like you were a doll. Sometimes you just wished you could look like your sisters, with their thin and delicate bodies.

That way people wouldn’t give you ‘looks’ while you’re just walking around, whispering behind your back, thinking you can’t hear them. And you couldn’t. But you could imagine what they were saying.

“Oh, she’s nothing like her mother”, “her sisters are so beautiful”, “she should take care of her self more”

The list continued. The thing was: you didn’t care, not anymore at least. You had grown as a woman, for the better; you didn’t listen to what those people said because the only one who knew you really was yourself and that was more than enough for you.

The trip didn’t take more than 2 days, your city wasn’t so far from Winterfell so it was good. If you were nervous before, now you felt like dying.

Once the doors opened, you tried your best to take a look from inside the carriage. The Starks where the people standing at the front, you assumed.

There were only two boys, one of them had curly hair and beautiful eyes but he was holding hands with a woman; 'he’s already married, that’s not Bran Stark’, you thought. The other one was blonde ish, but he was too young to be Bran, would your father be capable of marrying you with someone younger?

The Herald of Arms announced each member of your family. Once you were out of the carriage your father took your hand carefully and gave you a loving look. He might not be present most of the time but he was a great father and with that gesture you felt a little less nervous.

You found yourself about to pass out because of the nerves when you stood in front of the Starks. Your father and Lord Stark shared a hug, while your mother was greeted by Lady Stark. She was a beautiful woman, your thought.

When they finished talking your father reached to you, signaling you to take a step closer.

“This is my beautiful daughter, Y/N" your father said and you felt like dying when everyone standing in front of you looked in your direction.

You looked down, not wanting to see their expressions, but you had to be polite. When you lifted your head, everyone had a smile on their faces, honest smiles. They made you feel so welcome you were in complete awe.

“Welcome to Winterfell, Y/N” Lord Stark reached to you and took your hand in his, giving you a smile, so genuine.

“Please, let me introduce you to my son Bran” you were ready to greet to young blonde boy but then he took step aside and you were able to see the boy sitting on a wheelchair, staring a you. You weren’t really surprised but you felt kind of bad knowing that you hadn’t acknowledged him before.

“Lady Y/N, it’s nice too meet you” he said to you. He sounded so sincere, you couldn’t help but smile widely at him.

The day went by, while both families were sharing a fest. Bran and you tried several times to star a conversation but the music was so loud, you just couldn’t hear each other. He suggested you to join him for a walk so he could show you Winterfell around. Of course you said yes.

Bran showed you every little thing. Winterfell was incredibly beautiful, it wasn’t very far from your city but it was surprisingly different, the architecture was breathtaking and what surprised you the most was the dire wolves running around like dogs. The weather was also different, you weren’t used to this much cold.

You had to carry him around but you didn’t care, you had so much fun with him and it was so easy to start conversation, there were no uncomfortable silences.

When you were finishing your little tour, you reached the Weirwood, your family was devoted to the Old Gods too so you were familiar with it and even though you had seen paintings of this tree from your maester’s book several times, clearly it didn’t compare to see it in all its glory.

“It’s… it’s so beautiful, I’ve never seen one of them” you looked at Bran and he was smiling at you.

Your felt the heat on your cheeks. You were stupidly surprised by a tree.

“Sorry, I’ve just… I’ve just never seen one of them and I grew up with stories about the Old Gods, I got a little excited” you sat next to him.

“It’s fine, Y/N, really, I like that you’re enjoying yourself, this will be your home soon” he said and you looked at him, he was a beautiful boy for sure: pale skin that looked so soft and pink lips, he was actually breathtaking and you suddenly felt bad for him.

“I’m really sorry” you blurted.

Bran looked at you with a confused expression.

“I’m sorry you’re betrothed to me, there are plenty of better options.”

You didn’t dare to look at him but you were surprised when he took your hand and interlaced your fingers.

“Y/N please, look at me”

Slowly, you did. He was looking at you tenderly, and when you connected your eyes with his, you both smiled.

“You’re so beautiful, and I don’t really need five years of marriage to know you’re a very fun person with an amazing personality, our little Winterfell tour was all I needed to know I’m glad I’m betrothed to you” you didn’t want to, but you could feel the tears about to enter the scene “Look at me, I’m a cripple, but I know I’m so much more. And there’s you, you don’t have to look like every girl to be breathtaking, you already are” you couldn’t help it you hugged him tightly and he embraced you letting out a little laugh.

“You’re an amazing person Bran Stark” you said to and then realized you were inches apart when you said so. He looked at you intently.

“And you’re a beautiful girl and a good person, I’m thankful I get to marry you soon” the two of you stared at each other, wondering if it was okay. You surely didn’t want to rush things, you had meet him not so long ago but he already had your heart.

No one ever, who wasn’t a part of your family, was interested on knowing you and then Bran came in the picture all of a sudden, appreciating you for who you were and not asking for more or less.

And you did the same for him. Because you were able to see more than Bran the cripple, he was so much more and he was your future husband.

You stared into each other eyes and then Bran closed the distance between the two of you. His lips were soft against yours, and moved slowly, one of his hands was caressing your cheek lovingly, you never expected for this to happen, it felt unreal.

But right in this boy’s arms you felt safe. You felt home

The list continued. The thing was: you didn’t care, not anymore at least. You had grown as a woman, for the better; you didn’t listen to what those people said because the only one who knew you really was yourself and that was more than enough for you.

The trip didn’t take more than 2 days, your city wasn’t so far from Winterfell so it was good. If you were nervous before, now you felt like dying.

Once the doors opened, you tried your best to take a look from inside the carriage. The Starks where the people standing at the front, you assumed.

There were only two boys, one of them had curly hair and beautiful eyes but he was holding hands with a woman; 'he’s already married, that’s not Bran Stark’, you thought. The other one was blonde ish, but he was too young to be Bran, would your father be capable of marrying you with someone younger?

The Herald of Arms announced each member of your family. Once you were out of the carriage your father took your hand carefully and gave you a loving look. He might not be present most of the time but he was a great father and with that gesture you felt a little less nervous.

You found yourself about to pass out because of the nerves when you stood in front of the Starks. Your father and Lord Stark shared a hug, while your mother was greeted by Lady Stark. She was a beautiful woman, your thought.

When they finished talking your father reached to you, signaling you to take a step closer.

“This is my beautiful daughter, Y/N" your father said and you felt like dying when everyone standing in front of you looked in your direction.

You looked down, not wanting to see their expressions, but you had to be polite. When you lifted your head, everyone had a smile on their faces, honest smiles. They made you feel so welcome you were in complete awe.

“Welcome to Winterfell, Y/N” Lord Stark reached to you and took your hand in his, giving you a smile, so genuine.

“Please, let me introduce you to my son Bran” you were ready to greet to young blonde boy but then he took step aside and you were able to see the boy sitting on a wheelchair, staring a you. You weren’t really surprised but you felt kind of bad knowing that you hadn’t acknowledged him before.

“Lady Y/N, it’s nice too meet you” he said to you. He sounded so sincere, you couldn’t help but smile widely at him.

The day went by, while both families were sharing a fest. Bran and you tried several times to star a conversation but the music was so loud, you just couldn’t hear each other. He suggested you to join him for a walk so he could show you Winterfell around. Of course you said yes.

Bran showed you every little thing. Winterfell was incredibly beautiful, it wasn’t very far from your city but it was surprisingly different, the architecture was breathtaking and what surprised you the most was the dire wolves running around like dogs. The weather was also different, you weren’t used to this much cold.

You had to carry him around but you didn’t care, you had so much fun with him and it was so easy to start conversation, there were no uncomfortable silences.

When you were finishing your little tour, you reached the Weirwood, your family was devoted to the Old Gods too so you were familiar with it and even though you had seen paintings of this tree from your maester’s book several times, clearly it didn’t compare to see it in all its glory.

“It’s… it’s so beautiful, I’ve never seen one of them” you looked at Bran and he was smiling at you.

Your felt the heat on your cheeks. You were stupidly surprised by a tree.

“Sorry, I’ve just… I’ve just never seen one of them and I grew up with stories about the Old Gods, I got a little excited” you sat next to him.

“It’s fine, Y/N, really, I like that you’re enjoying yourself, this will be your home soon” he said and you looked at him, he was a beautiful boy for sure: pale skin that looked so soft and pink lips, he was actually breathtaking and you suddenly felt bad for him.

“I’m really sorry” you blurted.

Bran looked at you with a confused expression.

“I’m sorry you’re betrothed to me, there are plenty of better options.”

You didn’t dare to look at him but you were surprised when he took your hand and interlaced your fingers.

“Y/N please, look at me”

Slowly, you did. He was looking at you tenderly, and when you connected your eyes with his, you both smiled.

“You’re so beautiful, and I don’t really need five years of marriage to know you’re a very fun person with an amazing personality, our little Winterfell tour was all I needed to know I’m glad I’m betrothed to you” you didn’t want to, but you could feel the tears about to enter the scene “Look at me, I’m a cripple, but I know I’m so much more. And there’s you, you don’t have to look like every girl to be breathtaking, you already are” you couldn’t help it you hugged him tightly and he embraced you letting out a little laugh.

“You’re an amazing person Bran Stark” you said to and then realized you were inches apart when you said so. He looked at you intently.

“And you’re a beautiful girl and a good person, I’m thankful I get to marry you soon” the two of you stared at each other, wondering if it was okay. You surely didn’t want to rush things, you had meet him not so long ago but he already had your heart.

No one ever, who wasn’t a part of your family, was interested on knowing you and then Bran came in the picture all of a sudden, appreciating you for who you were and not asking for more or less.

And you did the same for him. Because you were able to see more than Bran the cripple, he was so much more and he was your future husband.

You stared into each other eyes and then Bran closed the distance between the two of you. His lips were soft against yours, and moved slowly, one of his hands was caressing your cheek lovingly, you never expected for this to happen, it felt unreal.

But right in this boy’s arms you felt safe. You felt home

summary: Sorry! Marvel, DC, Star Wars, GoT 5’7”, female. Auburn hair, blue eyes, fair skin though it freckles in the sun. I love a cozy...
question: Sorry! Marvel, DC, Star Wars, GoT 5’7”, female. Auburn hair, blue eyes, fair skin though it freckles in the sun. I love a cozy day at home reading. Coffee junkie. Love a good sense of humor and someone to have geeky, random, tangential conversations with. Will fight anyone for the people I love and work best as the (wo)man behind the curtain.
answer:
I ship you with …

Marvel:

Peter! You want someone to have nerdy conversations with? Peter’s your guy! He’s the type of person to be dead tired and still get lost in the Star Wars Wikipedia pages until 3 am, so he would definitely be perfect to have in depth nerdy conversations with!

DC:

I ship you with Bruce! He’s also a huge geek, and would absolutely love having those lengthy, in depth conversations with you. He is also willing to do anything for the people he loves, so he would like that you are willing to do the same. Also, he could never have too many sidekicks or eyes above, so he would love having you as his woman behind the curtain!

Star Wars:

I ship you with Finn! I’m convinced that he is a big geek, so he would love listening to your geeky conversations for hours on end! He would love you because he is also willing to die for his loved ones, and knowing that he has that kind of support for you and vice versa, there’s nothing the two of you can’t do.

Game of Thrones:

I ship you with Bran! He can literally have conversations about anything, so he would definitely like having the deep, random conversations with you that you like to have. Also he prefers to be the person behind the curtain, too, and would value that trait in you!

question: I liked your Bransa because it's the feel Ive been craving for, actually, for Meera/Bran since she recoiled from him in s7. Have you had any inklings about that ship? Like in a 'she knew BRAN and she knows exactly what he is now and yells for about an hour hearing he was vOTED king' lmao. Or if you have any half formed ideas about Meera, Reed's remaining heir, taking over & knowing something is not right about Sansa. Would she mercy kill her? Free her into a wolf? Some tea that blocks Bran temp?
answer:
It’s all right if you dont have any ideas to actually commit to writing and just respond privately saying so! I just noticed in many fandoms you have some unique ideas that make terrible canon twists actually interesting (ex: klonnie, bonkai) and if theres any ideas youd even vaguely have about what directions a house like Reed that is very old religion would go, in your 3EBran universe.

here’s the funny thing!

before writing bransa i totally thought of a meera/dark!bran oneshot, i just put it on hold but! i’d love to write one where bran informs tyrion  very calmly that he needs to send the Kingsguard to fetch his queen. and tyrion would be completely flummoxed like “wh-wh-whaat? but you’re….i mean….huuuuh???” (basically that meme of that lady doing algebra in her head) and bran just smiles and says, “i would hate for her to get away” 

and cut to meera stringing an arrow, trying to fight off the soldiers who have surrounded her. one of them holds a sword to howland’s throat. she knows there’s no hope. they catch her and bring her to king’s landing. she’s brought directly before the king.

meera: what the hell is this? what do you think you’re doing, summoning me? my father never agreed to this, greywater does not recognize you as -

bran: you once expressed your discontent at not being properly rewarded. after all, you helped me, stood by my side all this time and when it was said and done, i dismissed you with barely a thank you. 

meera, defiantly: i remember. i don’t need your gratitude anymore. you’re not bran. you’ve tainted the three-eyed raven’s legacy too.

bran: taint is the three-eyed raven’s legacy. consider this my way of making it up to you. 

meera, looking around her in fear: what exactly do you want?

bran smiles, clasps his hands: you will make a lovely queen. sweet, but strong. in time, you will give the realm an heir.

meera: but you - you can’t do this - 

bran: i can do many things, i can be many people. consider this a gift. 

(and if you’re wondering how bran would impregnate meera….well, i don’t wanna give the game away because i’m going to write about that in my bransa fic…but it’s fucked up lol)

anyway, i might just write it! and thank you for saying that about my writing!

summary: psst.. bran crying headcanons ;) love your writing btw
question: psst.. bran crying headcanons ;) love your writing btw

summary:
crying headcanons. bran stark:
Bran was hardly the type to show any emotion, and mostly right now, with the whole...
body:
crying headcanons. bran stark:

  • Bran was hardly the type to show any emotion, and mostly right now, with the whole “three-eyed-raven” thing.
  • It’s super hard for him to let out the things he’s been keeping to himself since he doesn’t want you to feel bad for him.
  • But he knows you’re there for him.
  • And when things become way too much to handle alone he just goes to you looking for comfort.
  • The two of you would be laying in bed at night, he’d tell you about his family before everything fell apart and how much he misses the old times somedays. It seemed easier.
  • His nose gets red and his face is all puffy. You just can’t help thinking he’s the cutest boy even when crying.
  • He would rest his head on your chest, trying to fight the urge to cry, but when you start slowly rubbing his back telling him sweet things about him, he just let go.
  • He feels safe with you. At home.
  • He gets all embarrassed omg.
  • “You look cute when you cry.”
  • “Stop, Y/N.”
  • You’d fill him with compliments like that trying to make him feel better.
  • “I love you, you can always come to me.”
  • “I know, love.”
  • When you cry (which is very often may I add) he’d ask everyone to leave the two of you alone till you calm down at least.
  • You’d be a mess because sometimes the pressure is too much you feel like you can’t take it no more.
  • But Bran’s always there for you.
  • You’re literally the person he cares the most, the two of you had been through so many things he just hated to see you cry.
  • He hugs you while caressing your hair, leaving little kisses on the top of your head.
  • “It’s ok, you can cry. I’m here for you, love.”
  • Sometimes you just cry for the most in innsignificant things, but Bran still comforts you and once you’re done, the both of you start laughing like crazy.
  • “I can’t believe you just cried because of that.”
  • “It was embarrassing. I TRIPPED IN FRONT OF EVERYONE, BRAN”
  • Tons of I love you’s.
  • Also HUGS!!
  • Always being there for each other.

oh my good, i need a bran

also I didn’t proof read, so fingers crossed everything’s ok. feel free to request

summary: Should jon ride a dragon, do you think he will warg into it like with ghost? I’ve seen a lot of theories saying that bran will...
question: Should jon ride a dragon, do you think he will warg into it like with ghost? I’ve seen a lot of theories saying that bran will warg into a dragon, but I don’t see why jon wouldn’t be the one since he would actually be riding one. Thank you!
answer:
Warging into dragons would be supremely difficult, since dragons have been established to be some of the most intelligent and dangerous creatures within the ASOIAF world. I don’t discount Bran trying and possibly succeeding, since he is a very powerful greenseer and warg (and as he trains becomes more and more powerful). At the moment, however, we know that sorcery and powerful horns are the go-to for controlling dragons, and that even Euron, an implied greenseer, is placing his bets on Victarion and the horn.

Since Jon, though still a warg, isn’t as powerful as Bran or Euron, I tend to think his abilities will remain secluded to Ghost. The bond he forms with whichever dragon he rides will be influenced by Targaryen blood, whereas his bond with Ghost goes far deeper.

There’s also the possibility that Jon won’t want to telepathically bond with any creature other than Ghost. His interim after death is going to bring them incredibly close, and I wouldn’t be surprised if Jon just outright refused to warg into anything else.

Thanks for the question, anon!

title: My Exception (Brandon/Bran Stark x Reader)
body:
MASTERLIST

Pairing: Bran Stark x Reader

Word Count: 2155

Warnings: Self-doubt, mild angst, spoilers for seasons 1-8, pretty OOC Bran despite my best efforts

Request: If you do write for him, could I request a smut and/or fluff fic for Bran Stark? Maybe about marrying him? -(Anon) 

A/N: I do write for him! I don’t have a whole lot of feelings for him myself so I don’t know how good this will turn out, but I promise to do my best!

You pushed Bran around in the gardens of the Red Keep, relishing in the warm sunlight. You may have been a girl from the North, but that doesn’t mean that you had to love the cold.

“The lilies are beginning to bloom,” you said with a gesture to the pink blossoms. “They look so beautiful.”

“Not as beautiful as you, my dear,” replied your fiance Bran. As Queen-To-Be you took it upon yourself to brighten up the Red Keep yourself. While the builders worked on restoring the inside of the building, you got your hands dirty in the garden. You may have earned yourself a sunburn or two, but you didn’t mind so long as something beautiful could grow again in King’s Landing. After the battle most of the plants were destroyed, either burned or covered in ash and debris. Finally, the new seeds were blooming vibrantly.

As you came to the end of the garden path you saw a short figure making his way towards the two of you.

“Lord Tyrion, how lovely to see you on this fine morning.” You say with a smile. Tyrion smiles a small smile in return.

“It is lovely to see you as well, Lady Y/N. I would like to congratulate you on how the garden is coming, I must admit that the lavender blooms are my favorite.” You beamed at the compliment. “I’m not just here to admire your handiwork though, I have come to remind your fiance about the small council meeting that started nearly twenty minutes ago.” He shot a sharp look at Bran.

“Oh my goodness!” You exclaimed as you flushed. “That was all my fault! I lost track of time showing Bran around the gardens, I am so sorry Tyrion.”

“It’s alright Darling, I forgot as well.” Said Bran comfortingly, looking up at you with those deep eyes you loved yo much. He reached back to grab your hand in his. Tyrion looked at Bran knowingly; Bran does not forget.

Podrick came up to assist Bran to the small council chamber, and you began making your way through the castle. While your future husband worked on fixing the political climate of the six kingdoms, you took it upon yourself to renew the beauty of the Red Keep and King’s Landing. You made many trips around the halls, looking for projects to be done. Just last week you had commissioned a series of paintings to hang in the new throne room when it was finished. You wanted scenes of the war to be depicted, both good and bad. This way future generations would have a reminder of the horror right in the room in which they ruled.

As you meandered down the corridors for a considerable amount of time until you began to hear a small commotion coming from one of the rooms. The closer you got to the room, the more apparent it became that it was full of ladies from the court, chattering and occasionally roaring with laughter. You had never really fit in with the rest of the ladies, but you figured it was worth a shot to try. After all, as Queen you would have to interact with these ladies much more frequently. You began to enter the room, but stopped dead in your tracks as their words found their way to your ears.

“I bet he doesn’t really even like her,” said one of the ladies as the rest had giggled. They could be talking about anyone, you reminded yourself from your place in the doorway. However, you had a knowing, sinking feeling in the pit of your stomach. You decided to listen in but not move, as they had not noticed you quite yet. 

“Of course he doesn’t!” Yelled one women as they all erupted into chuckles. “He doesn’t like anyone! He’s the ‘three-eyed-raven’ who doesn’t want!” The woman did a horrendous impression of Bran at the end, making tears spring to your eyes. Not only were they mocking Bran, but also speaking of his false love for you.

“If he doesn’t want, how could he want her? If he is just choosing at random, he could have at least chosen somebody beautiful.” The tears threatened to slip.

“It’s as if she is so stupid that she is unaware of how insincere his affection towards her.”

“And it is as if you are all so stupid that you are unaware of your surroundings,” you said, mustering all your courage so that it did not sound as if you were on the verge of tears. It worked, making all the ladies turn towards you with a gasp. Their reaction spurred you on, taking on a cold demeanor. “You speak of the future Queen behind her back as if she is not there. Though, of course, you had assumed that I was not. Perhaps you should have taken notice of who was entering the room instead of carrying on like children.”

Despite gossiping about you mere seconds ago, this shift in your personality left them speechless and wide-eyed. You held the power, and they all knew it.

“Do not talk about me and my husband-to-be like this again, or there will be consequences.” Your delivery rivaled even Cersei’s, surprising you with just how cold and calculated the words sounded coming from your lips. The ladies nodded, hurrying to leave the room. 

As they left, you too began the walk back to your chambers. It was getting rather late anyway, and the sun was beginning its descent through the sky as the moon began to appear. You slowly made your way back down the corridor to your bedroom. With every step you took, the bravado began to fade and the doubt began to surge through your mind again. The ladies were right. As the Three-Eyed-Raven, Bran was free from earthly wants and desires. It is what made him a good King; he is not selfish or greedy.  But you had not thought about what that meant for the two of you.

You had met as children, running around and getting into loads of trouble when your father would make his monthly visits to Winterfell. House (L/N) may be a small house, but it is a house of proud Northerners who used their closeness to the Lord and Lady Stark to their advantage. You looked back on those memories fondly. Bran and you would always climb anything you could get your hands and feet on, and you would always have to endure a scolding from your father afterwards. You never minded the trouble, so long as you got to hang out with your best friend. 

When you heard of Bran’s fall, you fell to your knees and cried. You thought that your friend would die. By some miracle of the Gods he did not, and you went to visit him as he lie in bed. You were told he would never walk again, and you knew that your climbing days were over. You didn’t mind. All you wanted was to spend time with him, whatever way you could.

The visits to the Starks became less frequent after Ned left for King’s Landing. After his execution, your father raced to Winterfell to help Robb and his army in any way that he could. You got to accompany him, but after Theon returned to take Winterfell you were whisked away to the Riverlands. You were informed of Bran and Rickard’s passing weeks later, falling into a deep lull for many months.

As Sansa and the other Starks returned to Winterfell years later, you returned as well. You reunited with Bran, feeling something special spark as your eyes landed on him for the first time in years. It was more than just seeing an old friend. In fact, it was even more than just seeing your best childhood friend who you had believed was dead for years It was as if you were seeing your soulmate.

Now looking back on that memory, the way you felt, you realized that it may have been one-sided. You knew that he did not desire as he had before disappearing behind the wall, but you thought that you were different. You thought that he had loved you. Maybe instead he was able to read you like a book, realizing that you would be the easiest to have by his side because you would be there out of devotion instead of greed. Perhaps you were merely the most convenient.

Tears made their way from your eyes and down your cheeks as you finally reached the door, closing it behind you. To your surprise, Bran was already inside. You must have wandered the castle halls for longer than you thought. He turned his chair from where he had been sitting at the window so that he could face you.

“What is wrong, my dear?” He asked, using his arms to wheel his way over to you. Despite your obvious unhappiness, you did not want to admit to him your weakness.

“Nothing, Bran,’ you replied. He cocked his head.

“You never call me that.”

“Well it is your name.”

You began to get ready for bed, feeling Bran’s eyes on you as you did so.

“My love, I cannot help you unless you tell me what is wrong.” He said. You could hear the pain in his voice.

“As if you couldn’t just read my mind,” you retort hotly. Bran let out a sigh.

“You know that I promised never to do that to you, Y/N. You know that I love you and I respect your privacy. I would never use my greensight against you to see what has happened to make you so upset. I want you to tell me yourself if you decide to of your own accord.”

You took a deep, shaky breath.

“But do you?” You asked. Bran furrowed his brows.

“Do I what, Y/N?”

“You said you love me. Do you?” The tears began again, leaving hot trails on your face. His face fell. He reached out to you, pulling you to him so that you sat sideways across his lap. He held you with one arm as he wiped the tears as they fell from your eyes.

“Of course I do, my dear. You are so special to me. You are a light shining in my life every day and I am lucky to be able to call you my own. What would make you think that I may feel any other way about you?” Bran stared into your eyes and you knew he was telling the truth. His eyes were full of love and devotion, and you knew it. You leaned against his chest.

“You’re the Three-Eyed-Raven,” you say.

“Does that make me any less your fiance as well?”

“No, but it means that you do not have wants as normal people do.”

Realizing what you thought, Bran pulling you into a tight hug, caressing your hair. 

“You are right Y/N, I do not desire things as I did before I was pushed from that tower. But that does not mean that I do not desire you.”

You pulled back from him, looking into his eyes.

“I may not want land, or wealth, or power, and I may not desire in the same way. But you, my darling,” said Bran, looking at you with admiration, “are my exception. I want you more than anyone could ever want anything. The first time I saw you again after the start of the war I felt something change in me. You sparked desire that I thought I could never feel. I have full faith that fate brought us together, whether because I am the Three-Eyed-Raven or in spite of that. I do love you Y/N, with all of my heart.”

You crashed your lips to Bran’s, his moving in sync with yours as you moved your body to straddle him instead of sitting sideways. 

“I love you too Bran,” you said between kisses as you pulled back for air. He wheeled the two of you towards the bed that you shared, making you squeal and wrap your arms around his neck so that you wouldn’t fall.

“Come love, let’s get into bed so that I may lay with the woman I love. My fiancee.”

“Bran, that was rather cheesy. Especially for you.” He smiled up at you as you helped him into bed, sliding in beside him and letting his arms wrap around you.

“But you loved it, didn’t you?”

“My love, if you don’t hush up I won’t help you get up in the morning and you’ll be stuck here all day.” You retort with a blush.

“You’re a cruel woman,” he teased. “But I love you anyway.”

You turned to face him and see his smiling face. You snuggled closer to his chest.

“And I love you too, my dear.”

“As if you couldn’t just read my mind,” you retort hotly. Bran let out a sigh.

You took a deep, shaky breath.

“You’re the Three-Eyed-Raven,” you say.

“No, but it means that you do not have wants as normal people do.”

Realizing what you thought, Bran pulling you into a tight hug, caressing your hair. 

“You are right Y/N, I do not desire things as I did before I was pushed from that tower. But that does not mean that I do not desire you.”

You pulled back from him, looking into his eyes.

I have full faith that fate brought us together, whether because I am the Three-Eyed-Raven or in spite of that. I do love you Y/N, with all of my heart.”

You crashed your lips to Bran’s, his moving in sync with yours as you moved your body to straddle him instead of sitting sideways. 

“I love you too Bran,” you said between kisses as you pulled back for air. He wheeled the two of you towards the bed that you shared, making you squeal and wrap your arms around his neck so that you wouldn’t fall.

“Come love, let’s get into bed so that I may lay with the woman I love. My fiancee.”

“Bran, that was rather cheesy. Especially for you.” He smiled up at you as you helped him into bed, sliding in beside him and letting his arms wrap around you.

“But you loved it, didn’t you?”

“My love, if you don’t hush up I won’t help you get up in the morning and you’ll be stuck here all day.” You retort with a blush.

“You’re a cruel woman,” he teased. “But I love you anyway.”

You turned to face him and see his smiling face. You snuggled closer to his chest.

“And I love you too, my dear.”

Pairing: Bran Stark x Reader

Word Count: 2155

Warnings: Self-doubt, mild angst, spoilers for seasons 1-8, pretty OOC Bran despite my best efforts

Request: If you do write for him, could I request a smut and/or fluff fic for Bran Stark? Maybe about marrying him? -(Anon) 

A/N: I do write for him! I don’t have a whole lot of feelings for him myself so I don’t know how good this will turn out, but I promise to do my best!

You pushed Bran around in the gardens of the Red Keep, relishing in the warm sunlight. You may have been a girl from the North, but that doesn’t mean that you had to love the cold.

“The lilies are beginning to bloom,” you said with a gesture to the pink blossoms. “They look so beautiful.”

“Not as beautiful as you, my dear,” replied your fiance Bran. As Queen-To-Be you took it upon yourself to brighten up the Red Keep yourself. While the builders worked on restoring the inside of the building, you got your hands dirty in the garden. You may have earned yourself a sunburn or two, but you didn’t mind so long as something beautiful could grow again in King’s Landing. After the battle most of the plants were destroyed, either burned or covered in ash and debris. Finally, the new seeds were blooming vibrantly.

As you came to the end of the garden path you saw a short figure making his way towards the two of you.

“Lord Tyrion, how lovely to see you on this fine morning.” You say with a smile. Tyrion smiles a small smile in return.

“It is lovely to see you as well, Lady Y/N. I would like to congratulate you on how the garden is coming, I must admit that the lavender blooms are my favorite.” You beamed at the compliment. “I’m not just here to admire your handiwork though, I have come to remind your fiance about the small council meeting that started nearly twenty minutes ago.” He shot a sharp look at Bran.

“Oh my goodness!” You exclaimed as you flushed. “That was all my fault! I lost track of time showing Bran around the gardens, I am so sorry Tyrion.”

“It’s alright Darling, I forgot as well.” Said Bran comfortingly, looking up at you with those deep eyes you loved yo much. He reached back to grab your hand in his. Tyrion looked at Bran knowingly; Bran does not forget.

Podrick came up to assist Bran to the small council chamber, and you began making your way through the castle. While your future husband worked on fixing the political climate of the six kingdoms, you took it upon yourself to renew the beauty of the Red Keep and King’s Landing. You made many trips around the halls, looking for projects to be done. Just last week you had commissioned a series of paintings to hang in the new throne room when it was finished. You wanted scenes of the war to be depicted, both good and bad. This way future generations would have a reminder of the horror right in the room in which they ruled.

As you meandered down the corridors for a considerable amount of time until you began to hear a small commotion coming from one of the rooms. The closer you got to the room, the more apparent it became that it was full of ladies from the court, chattering and occasionally roaring with laughter. You had never really fit in with the rest of the ladies, but you figured it was worth a shot to try. After all, as Queen you would have to interact with these ladies much more frequently. You began to enter the room, but stopped dead in your tracks as their words found their way to your ears.

“I bet he doesn’t really even like her,” said one of the ladies as the rest had giggled. They could be talking about anyone, you reminded yourself from your place in the doorway. However, you had a knowing, sinking feeling in the pit of your stomach. You decided to listen in but not move, as they had not noticed you quite yet. 

“Of course he doesn’t!” Yelled one women as they all erupted into chuckles. “He doesn’t like anyone! He’s the ‘three-eyed-raven’ who doesn’t want!” The woman did a horrendous impression of Bran at the end, making tears spring to your eyes. Not only were they mocking Bran, but also speaking of his false love for you.

“If he doesn’t want, how could he want her? If he is just choosing at random, he could have at least chosen somebody beautiful.” The tears threatened to slip.

“It’s as if she is so stupid that she is unaware of how insincere his affection towards her.”

“And it is as if you are all so stupid that you are unaware of your surroundings,” you said, mustering all your courage so that it did not sound as if you were on the verge of tears. It worked, making all the ladies turn towards you with a gasp. Their reaction spurred you on, taking on a cold demeanor. “You speak of the future Queen behind her back as if she is not there. Though, of course, you had assumed that I was not. Perhaps you should have taken notice of who was entering the room instead of carrying on like children.”

Despite gossiping about you mere seconds ago, this shift in your personality left them speechless and wide-eyed. You held the power, and they all knew it.

“Do not talk about me and my husband-to-be like this again, or there will be consequences.” Your delivery rivaled even Cersei’s, surprising you with just how cold and calculated the words sounded coming from your lips. The ladies nodded, hurrying to leave the room. 

As they left, you too began the walk back to your chambers. It was getting rather late anyway, and the sun was beginning its descent through the sky as the moon began to appear. You slowly made your way back down the corridor to your bedroom. With every step you took, the bravado began to fade and the doubt began to surge through your mind again. The ladies were right. As the Three-Eyed-Raven, Bran was free from earthly wants and desires. It is what made him a good King; he is not selfish or greedy.  But you had not thought about what that meant for the two of you.

You had met as children, running around and getting into loads of trouble when your father would make his monthly visits to Winterfell. House (L/N) may be a small house, but it is a house of proud Northerners who used their closeness to the Lord and Lady Stark to their advantage. You looked back on those memories fondly. Bran and you would always climb anything you could get your hands and feet on, and you would always have to endure a scolding from your father afterwards. You never minded the trouble, so long as you got to hang out with your best friend. 

When you heard of Bran’s fall, you fell to your knees and cried. You thought that your friend would die. By some miracle of the Gods he did not, and you went to visit him as he lie in bed. You were told he would never walk again, and you knew that your climbing days were over. You didn’t mind. All you wanted was to spend time with him, whatever way you could.

The visits to the Starks became less frequent after Ned left for King’s Landing. After his execution, your father raced to Winterfell to help Robb and his army in any way that he could. You got to accompany him, but after Theon returned to take Winterfell you were whisked away to the Riverlands. You were informed of Bran and Rickard’s passing weeks later, falling into a deep lull for many months.

As Sansa and the other Starks returned to Winterfell years later, you returned as well. You reunited with Bran, feeling something special spark as your eyes landed on him for the first time in years. It was more than just seeing an old friend. In fact, it was even more than just seeing your best childhood friend who you had believed was dead for years It was as if you were seeing your soulmate.

Now looking back on that memory, the way you felt, you realized that it may have been one-sided. You knew that he did not desire as he had before disappearing behind the wall, but you thought that you were different. You thought that he had loved you. Maybe instead he was able to read you like a book, realizing that you would be the easiest to have by his side because you would be there out of devotion instead of greed. Perhaps you were merely the most convenient.

You must have wandered the castle halls for longer than you thought. He turned his chair from where he had been sitting at the window so that he could face you.

“What is wrong, my dear?” He asked, using his arms to wheel his way over to you. Despite your obvious unhappiness, you did not want to admit to him your weakness.

“You never call me that.”

You leaned against his chest.
